meanings.definition: To chew or bite on something repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit chawed on the carrot slowly.
meanings.sent2: She chawed her gum loudly during class.
meanings.sent3: The puppy chawed on the shoe, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The old man chawed on his memories, lost in thought.
meanings.sent5: The beaver chawed through the wood with determination.

meanings.sent1: He chawed the steak before swallowing it.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel chawed on the nut it found.
meanings.sent3: The child chawed on the bubblegum, making funny faces.
meanings.sent4: Time chawed away at the ancient ruins, leaving only remnants.
meanings.sent5: The machine chawed through the metal with ease.
